app.title: Wine Shelf Scanner
app.description: Never guess at the wine shelf again. Ratings from 21 million reviews, on every bottle, instantly.

camera.heroTitle: Never guess at the wine shelf again.
camera.heroSubtitle: Ratings from 21 million reviews — on every bottle, instantly.
camera.dragDrop: Drag and drop an image here

processing.aiIdentifying: Our AI is identifying bottles and fetching ratings. This may take a few seconds.
processing.tip1: Tap any rating badge to see details
processing.tip2: Top-rated bottles get a gold highlight

results.bottlesFound: {count, plural, one {# bottle found} other {# bottles found}}

fallback.popularWines: Here are some popular wines you might be looking for

about.title: Wine Shelf Scanner
about.description: Ratings aggregated from 21 million reviews across community wine platforms. Individual scores are combined to provide a single trusted rating for each bottle.
about.disclaimer: Ratings sourced from community wine platforms. Wine Shelf Scanner is not affiliated with any rating provider.

bugReport.notExpected: Not what you expected? Report an issue

warmup.title: Dusting off the cellar
warmup.message: We keep our server asleep to save on hosting costs (wine isn't cheap!). Hang tight while it wakes up — usually about a minute.
warmup.tip1: The world's most expensive bottle sold for $558,000 — a 1945 Romanee-Conti
warmup.tip2: There are more than 10,000 grape varieties used for wine worldwide
warmup.tip3: Champagne has about 49 million bubbles per bottle
warmup.tip4: The oldest known wine cellar is over 6,000 years old, found in Armenia
warmup.tip5: Wine was first made around 6000 BC in the region now known as Georgia
warmup.tip6: A 'butt' is an actual unit of wine measurement — about 126 gallons
warmup.tip7: The Vatican has the highest per-capita wine consumption in the world
warmup.tip8: It takes about 600 grapes to make one bottle of wine
warmup.tip9: Ancient Romans added lead to wine to sweeten it. Please don't try this.
warmup.tip10: Fear of wine is called 'oenophobia.' You clearly don't have it.
warmup.tip11: Women tend to be better wine tasters — they have more taste buds on average
warmup.tip12: California produces about 85% of all American wine
warmup.tip13: In space, wine would boil because of the low pressure. NASA has not confirmed this.
warmup.tip14: The custom of toasting started in ancient Rome to make sure the wine wasn't poisoned
warmup.tip15: There's a high-end wine called 'Screaming Eagle' and a bottle goes for thousands
warmup.tip16: Some monks in Belgium brew beer to fund their monastery. But we're here for wine.
warmup.tip17: Thomas Jefferson was one of America's first great wine nerds
warmup.tip18: Red wine gets its color from grape skins, not grape juice
warmup.tip19: A single vine can produce about 10 bottles of wine
warmup.tip20: The word 'sommelier' comes from old French for 'pack animal driver.' Glamorous.
